1.text: I commend to you Phoebe, our sister, who is a servant of the Church that is at Cenchreae,

2.text: so that you receive her in the Lord in a way worthy of the saints. Also, may you assist her in whatever matter she may need from you since she has been a benefactor to many, including myself.

3.text: Greet Priscilla and Aquila, my fellow workers in Christ Jesus,

4.text: who risked their own lives for my sake. I am grateful to them, and with me all the Churches of the Gentiles.

5.text: Greet the Church that is in their house and Epaenetus, my beloved, who is the first fruits of Achaia to Christ.

6.text: Greet Mary, who labored much for us.

7.text: Greet Andronicus and Junia, my relatives and fellow-prisoners who are outstanding among the apostles, who also were in Christ before me.

8.text: Greet Amplias, my beloved in the Lord.

9.text: Greet Urbanus, our fellow worker in Christ, and Stachys, my beloved.

10.text: Greet Apelles, the approved in Christ. Greet those who are of the household of Aristobulus.

11.text: Greet Herodion, my relative. Greet those of the household of Narcissus, who are in the Lord.

12.text: Greet Tryphaena and Tryphosa, who work hard in the Lord. Greet Persis, the beloved, who has labored much in the Lord.

13.text: Greet Rufus, the chosen in the Lord, and his mother, a mother to me as well.

14.text: Greet Asyncritus, Phlegon, Hermas, Patrobas, Hermes, and the brethren who are with them.

15.text: Greet Philologus and Julia, Nereus and his sister, Olympas, and all the saints who are with them.

16.text: Greet one another with a holy kiss. The Churches of Christ greet you.

17.text: Now I beg you, brethren, watch out for those who are causing divisions and occasions of stumbling, contrary to the doctrine which you learned. Stay away from them!

18.text: Such people do not serve our Lord Jesus Christ, but their own belly. By their smooth and flattering speech, they deceive the hearts of the innocent.

19.text: Indeed, your obedience has become known to all and I rejoice over you. I desire to have you wise in what is good, but innocent in what is evil,

20.text: and the God of peace will quickly crush Satan under your feet. May the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you!

21.text: Timothy, my fellow worker, greets you, as do Lucius, Jason, and Sosipater, my relatives.

22.text: I, Tertius, who write the letter, greet you in the Lord.

23.text: Gaius, my host and host of the whole Church, greets you. Erastus, the treasurer of the city, greets you, as does Quartus, the brother.

24.text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all! Amen.
